meanings.definition: To exert oneself to the utmost
meanings.sent1: She had to strain to lift the heavy box.
meanings.sent2: He strained his muscles while working out at the gym.
meanings.sent3: The little ant tried to strain to carry the giant crumb.
meanings.sent4: The engine strained as it tried to climb the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: With a loud grunt, he strained to open the stubborn jar lid.

meanings.sent1: If you strain your voice, you might lose it.
meanings.sent2: She strained her back from lifting too much weight.
meanings.sent3: He managed to strain his ankle just before the big race.
meanings.sent4: The old rope finally gave way, strained beyond its limit.
meanings.sent5: Be careful not to strain your eyes by staring at the screen for too long.

meanings.definition: A group of organisms within a species
meanings.sent1: The new strain of bacteria was resistant to antibiotics.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the genetic makeup of the strain of fruit flies.
meanings.sent3: The strain of fish in the pond seemed to be thriving.
meanings.sent4: The strain of virus was spreading rapidly through the population.
meanings.sent5: The strain of wheat developed by the researchers was more resilient to drought.

meanings.definition: A particular kind, sort, or type
meanings.sent1: This strain of roses has a beautiful fragrance.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a special strain of chili peppers in the dish.
meanings.sent3: The strain of music playing in the background was soothing.
meanings.sent4: The strain of fabric used for the dress was soft and comfortable.
meanings.sent5: I prefer this strain of tea over the other varieties.

meanings.definition: Pressure, force, or stress on an object
meanings.sent1: The strain on the bridge caused it to collapse.
meanings.sent2: The strain on the rope was too much for it to bear.
meanings.sent3: The strain on the tree branch made it bend under the weight.
meanings.sent4: The strain on the athlete's body was evident after the race.
meanings.sent5: The strain on the dam threatened its stability.
